beats.label: HOOK
beats.narration: Here's where Gravel Locos breaks you. 157 mi. Zone by zone.
beats.visual: Full route map, then zoom into first zone
beats.editing_note: Start with full route visible, then rapid zoom in. Ominous music hit. Avatar suffering face.

beats.label: ZONE 1: Mile 60
beats.narration: Mile 60. Heat-Soaked Mid-Race. Heat typically spikes. Shade is scarce. If you've under-hydrated, you start to unravel here while still far from home.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Smooth, fast Hill Country gravel with endless rollers

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 1 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 2: Mile 100
beats.narration: Mile 100. After the 3B Climbs. This is where the 2022 aid station ran out of water. Riders waited 30+ minutes at 120°F. Even in good years, this is where under-prepared riders crack.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Smooth, fast Hill Country gravel with endless rollers

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 2 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).

beats.label: ZONE 3: Mile 150
beats.narration: Mile 150. Final Ascent to Hico. Rolling climb back into town. 7.9 thousand ft of gain catches up to you here. Cramps and mental fatigue hit hardest in the final miles.
beats.visual: Route map with zone marker animation

broll_sources.query: gravel cycling Smooth, fast Hill Country gravel with endless rollers

beats.editing_note: Zone marker 3 appears on map. Progressive color intensity (green→yellow→red).
